summary.p: EditField is used to change some attributes of fields.

description.p: EditField can change certain attributes of fields including repositioning the field in object space, rescaling the data values, changing the type of the data stored at the elements and change/add properties such as the name of the field.
EditField creates an exact copy of the input field, edits the copy as indicated by the various UI widgets, then sends the copy to the output port.
A box widget used to translate and/or resize the field.
The matrix that represents the transformations made by the widget.
The EditField UI consists of two major sections: input field attributes and output field attributes.
The input field attributes describe the field on the input port, and the output field attributes describe the field to be sent to the output port.

When EditField is included in a network that is saved to disk, only the output field attributes are saved. When such a network is later loaded from disk and executed, the field that is sent to EditField must be type compatible with the contents of the saved UI elements. If the field is not type compatible, EditField will return NULL instead of an edited field.
The field's datatype. Includes information about the type of mesh (TetVol, LatticeVol, TriSurf, etc.) as well as the type of the data (unsigned char, double, Vector, Tensor, etc.).
The 6 entries describe two 3D points, which are the min and max points of the axis aligned bounding box of the field.
The 2 entries are the min and max data values present in the field. It applies only if the data is scalar.
The location where data "lives" within the field. Can be Cell (data lives at the center of the cells), Node (data lives at the nodes) or None (no data present, just a mesh).
The number of nodes present in the field.
The number of elements present in the field.

Each of the checkboxes in the output field attributes section controls whether that attribute will be included as part of the edited output field. Unchecked means that the associated attribute will not be edited (even if the values are different from the input field attributes), and checked means that it will be edited.
Click this button to copy the values from the input field attributes section to the output field attributes section. Doing this will fill the typename option menu with compatible types.
